text:
.
Risk factors 
• Obesity - with a BMI of 30 or over
• Family history of Type 2 diabetes
• If the mother had previously delivered 
larger babies (4 kilograms or more)
• If the woman has high blood pressure 
Complications of Gestational 
Diabetes  
• An extra large baby, which can cause a difficult delivery, possible nerve damage, and even stillbirth.
• Later development of type 2 diabetes in the mother and the baby.
